comment.author: 82214664@N00
comment._content: Magee wasn't the manager. He was only 25/26 years old during the 1915 season.

comment.author: 39338509@N00
comment._content:
That would not have made him the youngest manager in baseball history.  I believe Bucky Harris was 24 when he led the Washington Senators to a world championship in 1924.

I stand corrected.  Harris was 27.

comment.author: 39338509@N00
comment._content: Magee was born in 1889, which would have made a young-looking 35/36 at the time and, yes, he was the manager for part of that season..

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Looks like was a player/manager for most of the season (118 games), with 35 games managed by John Ganzel. www.baseball-reference.com/managers/mageele01.shtml www.baseball-reference.com/managers/ganzejo01.shtml I've edited his Wikipedia entry to make this clearer.
